<math alttext="C, solid, plus H 2 O gas, react to produce, C O gas, plus H 2 gas. Delta H naught equals, positive 131 kilojoules per mole of reaction" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mtext>C</mtext> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>s</mi> <mo>)</mo> <mo>+</mo> </mrow> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>H</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mtext>O</mtext> <mo>(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>→</mo> <mtext>CO</mtext> <mo>(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>+</mo> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>H</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mo>(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo>)</mo> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="2.0em"> </mspace> </mrow> <mrow> <mtext>Δ</mtext> <msup> <mi>H</mi> <mo>∘</mo> </msup> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mo>+</mo> <mn>131</mn> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"> </mspace> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>kJ/mol</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>r</mi> <mi>x</mi> <mi>n</mi> </mrow> </msub> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>

The reaction between <math alttext="C, solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="H 2 O gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is represented by the balanced chemical equation above. Based on the enthalpy change of the reaction (<math> <semantics> <mrow> <mtext>Δ</mtext><msup> <mi>H</mi> <mo>∘</mo> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaahqart1ev3aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGuoGaamisam aaCaaaleqabaGaeSigI8gaaaaa@3C48@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>) and the standard heats of formation (<math> <semantics> <mrow> <mtext>Δ</mtext> <msubsup> <mi>H</mi> <mi>f</mi> <mo>∘</mo> </msubsup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaahqart1ev3aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGuoGaamisam aaDaaaleaacaWGMbaabaGaeSigI8gaaaaa@3D33@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>) given in the table below, what is the approximate <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mtext>Δ</mtext> <msubsup> <mi>H</mi> <mi>f</mi> <mo>∘</mo> </msubsup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaahqart1ev3aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGuoGaamisam aaDaaaleaacaWGMbaabaGaeSigI8gaaaaa@3D33@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> for <math alttext="C O gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?
